Reviews.Title: “miserable hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: eli2012
Reviews.Content: where do i begin - i understand the phrase `you get what you pay for`, but when rooms start at a minimum of 65/70 a night for just a single room EXCLUDING extras like internet, then im sorry but you are paying over 100 dollars a night and do excpect decent service. I dont find the rooms or building that bad (i stayed in the main building with the reception) but generally speaking i found the area to be very noisy .. constant road works now we get to the BIG problem....... the person at the desk is the most miserable woman ive ever known, she rarely smiles or anything, when you pay for the night she simply grunts!!! the breakfast is a joke, you get there and wait 20 minutes even if there is nobody around! i wanted a couple of pieces of toast, - it took me 18 minutes for the guy in the room to ask me what i wanted, and another 20 to get it along with my orange juice! what a laugh.. and if you think im exagurating im not, many other reviews talk of waiting like 30 minutes in the breakfast room!!! the final straw was the internet which didnt even work for half of my stay - yet i still got charged the what is it 4 pounds a night for it? i stayed for 5 nights... huge waste of money would have been 100 times better had the person at the till been even the slightest bit human trust me guys dont stay here!! for this price you can get much nicer places also its a GOOD 10 maybe 15 min walk (if you know where your going) from victoria... and heaven help if you dont know where your going itd probably take about half an hour so its not exactly a stone throw away from the station

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pity about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmunnery
Reviews.Content: St. Gerge's Hotel is conveniently located in Pimlico, an easy walk even with luggage from Victoria tube station and Victoria train and coach station. It is closer still to Pimlico tube station which is on the Victoria Line. The Victoria line takes you to Green Park where you can change for Piccadilly and Liecester Square or stay on for Oxford Circus. Pimlico Road is great for high end antique shops and 'Harrods' at Knightsbridge. The hotel is in one of the many, at one time, 'grand' Regency town houses that dominate the area. On arrival our room was actually ready at 11am and we were given the keys. If this had not been the case they would have allowed us to leave our luggage. The triple room was comprised of a double and single bed. It was clean and the beds fairly comfortable. The washroom was also clean and there were adequate towls. However there was only one pillow per person and further pillows were not available. The decor of the room was very 'tired' and scruffy. There were no tea making facilities or anywhere to buy something to drink which was disappointing when returning late in the evening. A big minus for us was that breakfast was only available (at the house further up the road) between 6.30pm and 8.30am and after a late night out with friends, we were unable to make such an early time. We wasted the cost of breakfast which was included. We were asked if we would like a paper for the morning but when morning came there weren't any. Finally, St. Georges Drive is quite noisy and the windows were only single glazed. In addition, there is a major building project directly across the road, (affordable housing project) and the work started before we were awake and therefore woke us up. It was very noisy from drills etc. At 90.00 pounds for the triple it was not expensive but we did not feel it was worth the money. There are a number of other hotels in this area which as I said at the start is a convenient spot.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: LOrraine W
Reviews.Content: With only a week to spare we got a great deal. For this location(near Oxford street, theatres and quality houses) this hotel was a real find. We booked a twin room which had comfy beds and quality bedding/ decor. A good breakfast was included. Welcoming. Help with bags. Definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms old and tiny”
Reviews.Author: SSHLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family because of it's central location and the competitive rate. The B&B is cheap for a reason, you get what you pay for, extremely small and old rooms. Breakfast was only served until 8am. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Got the hotel from BA Vacations and wish I hadn't!”
Reviews.Author: lacrazia
Reviews.Content: This hotel even by european standards is shabby and not chic! The location is ideal very easy to get to all the touristy things to see and do but the accommodations are less than desireable. I had a single room which reeked of old stale cigarette smoke. It was small but that wasn't the problem the comforter and sheets looked old and dingy. The floor was a laminate one which creaked when you walked across it. The front desk was wasn't very friendly when you could locate them. Forget the restaurant it is overpriced and the food was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs”
Reviews.Author: ayrshire_lass85
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience with this hotel and would strongly urge others not to risk staying here!! I phoned the hotel twice before arriving; once to let them know I would be late and the second time to let them know I would be later still due to travel delays. Twice the hotel confirmed I had a booking. On arrival I was met by a gentleman who told me that they would do me a favour and let me stay for the night but then I had to be out the next morning as I didn't have a booking. He then produced my booking but said they hadn't found it until that night and despite me having already paid I would need to go elsewhere. When I queried why I had been told twice by hotel staff that it was ok he shouted at me and told me I had to leave and I should take it up with reception tomorrow. When I did I found the hotel to be fully booked for the remainder of the week. As yet I have had no refund and had to pay over the odds to arrange alternative accomodation at such short notice. The room I stayed in was dated and dirty and had limited facilities for example no tea+coffee, no tv, etc. I was not disappointed to be leaving in that regard. Take my advice - go elsewhere. There are hundreds of hotels in the area who will offer a better service for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Much better options elsewhere in Central london”
Reviews.Author: epingy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this place. Good location as it's only about 10 minutes walk from Victoria Station. We knew the room had a TV as we were handed the TV remote at check-in. It wasn't much use as none of the channels worked and when notified the hotel staff couldn't care less. The bed was horrible and the blanket had cigarette burns on it. The water in the shower was only lukewarm at best. We returned late at night after a day out to find the room door had been left open by someone. On the plus side we found that by hanging a metal coat hanger on the TV, we could watch BBC1. There is no lift so your heavy suitcases will need to be dragged up the narrow staircase without any help from hotel staff so this may not be suitable for everyone. We were too put off by this place to attempt to go into the basement for breakfast and basically if you must stay here just plan on being out and about in London for as much of the day as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: di h
Reviews.Content: The room was clean although v small. The bathroom door had a hole in it that resembled a fist had been put through it , making it look shabby , also the hairdryer was dismantled, luckily I wasn't going out for a posh dinner !!. I went for breakfast and as I travelling alone I was sat at a table with 2 French guys, it was a bit odd I thought as there were other free tables , but anyway I overcame that. The service seemed a bit sporadic, but I was served my toast, I had eaten one piece when I realised the next slice was MOULDY !! I immediately called the waitress who was apologetic and returned with another rack of toast, but I wasn't prepared to eat it . I reported it to the girl on Reception who would speak to the Manager about it. I had paid for 2 nights but the next morning I couldn't face breakfast in there. Also they stop serving at 8. 30 am which I think is early for a Sunday morning. I never heard anything back from the Manager, when I checked out the receptionist just said they would chat to their suppliers about it. and it has never happened before !!

Reviews.Title: “View and location was excellent, service was miserable”
Reviews.Author: BeckhamRamos
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we found the Hotel really quickly, it is positioned central and close to the Underground station "Pimlico". From the outside it looked really English (--> really nice) and it was on a quiet street. Unfortunately there's NO ELEVATOR, so we had to carry our luggage up the stairs. (five floors!) The rooms were clean and friendly, for two persons rather narrow. It is quiet and the view on a inner courtyard is interesting. Breakfast was troublesome, it is just until 8.35 am!!! The saloon is too small, every day you had to wait almost 30 minutes on the stairs until you could get into the room and start eating. The staff was unkind and they cleared the table when you not even began! You always had to hurry otherwise there wouldn't have been enough toast and stuff , really nerving!

Reviews.Title: “They can take a booking but cannot keep a booking!!!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyoutofUK
Reviews.Content: A week after booking and confirming our reservation we arrived to be told they had overbooked and we didn't have a room. Eventually they found a room through an agency on the other side of the river away from where we had to be and left us to make our own way there. POOR FORM AND TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ENRIKISER
Reviews.Content: Very small, high ladders, strong smell of bleach in little bathroom almost impossible stay in very small apt, disgust white old man at front desk, make my first time unforttable.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny room but clean and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: iscamorris
Reviews.Content: I had my case carried up the stairs which was welcome. Surprised to find the shower and toilet were in a separate room up a half flight of stairs and under the stairs - entry by my key card so it was in a sense private and it was very clean and new. There was not really anywhere to put a small case without blocking something. On the other hand it was cheap for London, I slept well, enjoyed the breakfast, could see Big Ben from my window in the morning and walk to my destination in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable no-frills hotel in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: rocketqueen22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September with my partner for a short city break. We paid about Â£70 per night for a double room, which was a more than reasonable cost for the location! We found the area was very safe and quiet., lovely to wander around at night. Hotel was a 5 minute walk to Pimlico tube station, and if you prefer to walk, it only took around 20 minutes to walk right to Big Ben. The room was clean, bedding was renewed daily, as were the towels. We had a private bathroom with a toilet, shower and sink which was beautifully decorated, and the shower was amazing! Very hot and powerful. The bed was relatively comfortable with adequate bedding. The TV in the room had a few channels that came in handy in the morning when getting ready. There were doubles wardrobes with mirrors, which were big enough to hold our clothes and luggage. Our room was on the top floor of the building and I must say the view we acquired was spectacular. From our window I could see Big Ben, London Eye, St Paul's, and The Gherkin...all creeping over the tops of the houses on the opposite side of the street. Was a really nice little bonus! We never sampled the breakfast, which was 6.30-8.30am, and the only negative I would point out is there is no lift in the hotel, and being on the top floor meant an 87-step climb at the end of a tiring day! The stairs are very steep and narrow, however this is expected in these types of converted London houses, and the staff do offer to take your luggage up to your room if required, which is a plus. All in all, if you're on a budget, and are looking for somewhere clean and central to stay, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SammyH63
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid Â£75 a night it was an ok hotel! Not happy with the basement room but again for the price! The second night it sounded like a heard of elephants were above us! Staff were rude there was no communication, was passed a piece of paper to fill in when i said that we had made a booking! Err Hello! Good location right by victoria train/coach station, buckingham palace!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, great breakfast, fantastic price in a safe neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: scarletflorida
Reviews.Content: If you have never traveled to Europe, you might not give this hotel a thumbs up; however, if you know what hotels in Europe are like you will recognize what a great value this hotel is. The breakfast was included in the cost--we paid 80 pounds per night for our room. Breakfast was served from 6:30-8:30 and choices included: one or two eggs (fried, poached, scrambled), bacon, beans, sausage, toast, juice, coffee. It was the best breakfast we have had in any of our journeys to Germany, France, Belgium, or the Netherlands! The rooms were an adequate size for two people with a large wardrobe for clothes, a desk and chair, hair dryer, tv, and a double bed. Linens were clean and the bathroom was an adequate size. Everything was spotless! The carpets, although not new, were perfectly clean. Our room was a freshly painted yellow with white and it had a large window. The area was very quiet on the backside of the hotel and my sister and her husband were on the street side and their room was also quiet. Towels were clean and of good quality. We were not in the same area of the hotel as the breakfast room so we had to walk downstairs from our rooms and then over two doors to get to reception and breakfast rooms--no problem for us. I guess we don't let silly little things get in the way of our trip. Reception desk and waitresses in the breakfast room were very nice and friendly to us. Reception area is a little crowded but who stays in the reception area when you have all of London to discover!!! This hotel is only about a 10 minute walk to the Pimlico station which is convenient for all parts of London. I saw many women walking to and from the station late at night and alone--we felt perfectly safe in this neighborhood. There were restaurants and small stores available in the area in case you needed toothpaste, etc. or snacks. All in all, this little hotel is a great place to stay if you are interested in a clean, safe environment and don't expect to be living in Buckingham Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Beware this is disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: KathandPamB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May and when we arrived the 'woman' at the reception that we later learned was from Honduras had a very rude and insolent manner! There was no-one available to take our cases up, and the room (more like a cupboard) where we had to either store some of our suitcases in the so-called wardrobe or in the room where we had to squeeze around them, the towel (loosely named such more like tea cloths) very small and thin, not to mention the bath mat that looked like someone had maybe used it to clean their car as it was ripped (I've use better to wipe floors) When we went down the terrible stairs for breakfast the choice was virtually NOTHING... one either had cornflakes or a sausage (1) piece of bacon (1) Egg (1) and cold toast, the waitress (who was from Colombia) tried to be helpful but was closely watched by the receptionist (owner/worker/nasty piece of work) to ensure that one didn't get anything extra for breakfast. When we asked the receptionist (sic) about the car parking that is stated clearly on their business cards she said 'no we don't have parking' when I showed her the business card she stated 'Oh yes of a weekend outside on the road if you can find a spot' when I told her that was false advertising she pretended not to understand English! Yeah right. Even if this place was FREE I would never stay there again, absolutely DISGUSTING. kath Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean and Perfectly Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Teaselshiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has attracted a lot of criticism which as far as we are concerned is unjustified. The room cost here is very competitive, though of coursethere are no frills. The room we had was more than adequate, the bed was good, the linen and cleanliness perfectly OK. The ensuite shower/bathroom was a reasonable size and worked perfectly well. The stairs are rather daunting but we were on the first floor so that was acceptable to me as a 70+ year old. We did NOT have breakfast but other residents said it was OK. There is a bakery and plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance, It was not very noisy though we faced the main road, quieter at the rear obviously. It would be difficult to park locally except at weekends. The nearest tube is Pimlico - 10/15 minutes walk - and there are nearby buses. Reception is a bit gruff and could be improved but we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly, will stay there often I hope”
Reviews.Author: Martar73
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the bad reviews of this hotel. I chose it based upon the recommendation of a friend from Hungary (I'm from the US) and I worried that perhaps her standards and mine were entirely different after reading what everyone here has written. But I found this hotel to be perfect for my needs, which were: well-located, clean, private bathroom that worked well, affordable, wireless internet availability, breakfast included. The St. George's was all of that. Sure, the hotel has no elevator--and believe me, tramping up six STEEP flights of stairs wasn't great for this 58-year old! But it was excellent exercise and in a way I enjoyed the challenge. (They delivered my huge, overpacked suitcase to the room for me, thank goodness.) The maid was thorough and very accommodating to me and my friends who often slept or hung around the room late in the mornings and threw off her schedule. Extra towels, if we needed them, were readily available, as was a better hairdryer. Breakfast is served very early but it was absolutely fine, and the coffee was FABULOUS. Eggs are cooked to order, the staff is very accommodating and sweet (I don't know what else they could have done that they didn't.. It's a family from Colombia and they seem sincerely interested in serving and making guests comfortable.) There are some things that aren't great: the beds are not good, very worn and not supportive. The carpeting everywhere is old, too, and makes the place look sort of dirty even though it isn't--the maid is thorough about vacuuming it everywhere. The triple room we stayed in for a few nights (and then we moved to a twin after one of our party left) was so small that we had to really re-arrange stuff to be able to walk out of the place in the morning...suitcases sometimes had to be on the bed or blocking the bathroom door. But heck we paid only L33 each per night for the room with private bath (and there was another very nice shared bathroom on the hall which was nice but not really needed except for retrieving more towels or toilet paper in the middle of the night when we were up late talking!) WHAT DO YOU EXPECT IN A PRICEY AREA OF LONDON??? I am no expert on London accommodations but if I had to choose a somewhat nicer b&b farther north or west, say, versus the St. George's which is a tube stop or two from everywhere and which has nice restaurants nearby and which is CHEAP, I would choose the St. George's without question. If you're planning to loll around in your room, though, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, affordable gem”
Reviews.Author: wylib
Reviews.Content: My friends booked this hotel & after reading these other entries I was prepared to have to move. Instead we were delightfully surprised - don't be scared off by the low price or bad reviews (there are other St. George's hotels in London -- maybe some of these reviews were linked here by mistake). The hotel, on St. George's drive, is spotlessly clean, in a charming and safe location (Pimlico) with public transport nearby and easy access to passing cabs. We found the staff friendly & helpful. Yes, it would be great if breakfast could be later but the reason they schedule it that way is very obvious - it's clearly a family running the whole operation and they don't have enough staff to extend it later & still get the rooms cleaned up & other tasks done. They probably should switch to a less labor-intensive buffet-style operation. The lack of staff led to some comic situations - at one point I was opening the locked front door for guests because all the staff was so busy serving breakfast. My advice would be, either plan to get to breakfast by 8:00-8:10 or just skip it -- there is a beautiful Italian deli halfway down the block on Lupus St. where you can get a delicious latte & roll very cheap, and it's like stepping into a foreign movie (the owner singing in Italian, his beautiful daughter serving at the counter & being flirted with by customers). There are also great restaurants nearby within walking distance (Goya, Grumbles). Also, remember this is London and most of these family-run B&Bs are converted old houses, with the corresponding old plumbing -- the toilets refill very slowly so you have to plan out your flushes if you have a roomie as I did. At several points we used the extra bathroom on the landing & were grateful to have it. Our bathroom was otherwise updated with tiling & fixtures and looked gorgeous. Oh, except for the built-in hairdryer, from the early 70s, which was hilarious, and worked ok but at a 1970s and not a 2010 standard - no big deal, i found it charming. And, yes, the stairs are very steep & narrow, the rooms are small and there are no elevators (again, both very common with this type of a London B&B), so if this is a deal-breaker for you don't go here or any other B&B. On the plus side, we got exercise without having to schedule it & all lost several pounds on the trip! I think somewhere on the website they said they had laundry on-site - they don't, but there's a great laundrette a block or so down. There are several internet cafes nearby - I didn't have a computer so I don't know about the wifi situation. Our group had some complex reservations transactions & changes and the staff handled them just fine. Bottom line: this isn't the Ritz, but if you want an affordable place to sleep that's easy to get around from, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent, incompetent,incompetent!”
Reviews.Author: MrFairUk
Reviews.Content: Breakfast on a Sat is served until 8.30. When we dragged ourselves out of bed to be there on time they kept us waiting 30 mins on stairs until a table was free(obviously everyone else had arrived at the last minute). Choice of a glass of orange or a small helping of cornflakes. Also a choice of how you want your egg done with your single small hard sausage and piece of bacon and beans. The fry arrived first. The cornflakes,toast, and coffee arrived 3 reminders later and after we had finished the fry. Had to pay for the WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Completely incompetent”
Reviews.Author: Kay087
Reviews.Content: I have never left a review before but the staff I have just dealt with here have been so rude and incompetent that I would like to advise others to avaoid this hotel. I made a booking for 12 rooms as I am organising an event in London. I did this over the phone and then also emailed confirmation. As it was for a large number of rooms I asked to pay by bank transfer raher than card and I was told i would be sent the bank details by the manager. When I did not receive these detils I phoned 3 times. On each occasion I was told the manager was not available but that the rooms were booked. Finally on the 4th time I was told they could not take the booking as they were already full. The girl I spoke to made no attempt to apologise at any point. I would definitely advise you not to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away !! Absolute Kip !!”
Reviews.Author: Banderos40
Reviews.Content: I have travelled quite a bit and stayed in numerous hotel. Never in my 40 years have I met a more obnoxious , unsocial , unhelpful and rude collection of people how run this shambles of a glorified B & B. The amount of issues I encountered here are too many to mention , but believe me , do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast served very early, no elevetor”
Reviews.Author: kinemagustavi
Reviews.Content: good location close to pmlico, small room, brakfast it's served too early. staff is polite but doesn't offer suggestions about the city. However it's clean and price are affordable.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff, misleading Website, incompetence reigns.”
Reviews.Author: Momof2Paris_Boston
Reviews.Content: Since I needed a hotel in London for my family for a couple of days only, and I did not mind a "budget/tourist" place, I chose "St. George's Hotel" in Pimlico/Victoria (St. George's Drive). I thought that it would be fine, as Eurostar thad it listed as a favorite. I am having a very hard time understanding why anyone would list St. George's as a favorite. And, before I go on, please understand that I am familiar with London, and with the type of hotel this is--I have stayed in many in the same category, in the Victoria and Bloomsbury areas, as well as in other parts of the UK. I did not want, nor did I expect, anything but a clean room, polite innkeepers, and a breakfast if it were promised. I was not expecting the Savoy, in other words. First, I called the hotel the day before our scheduled arrival to make sure all was in order, and to ask if we could keep our bags there until check in time. The woman on the phone was not only rude, but hung up on me. I called back, and she said she did not have a reservation for us (I had a confirmation from Eurostar, and had already paid for the room). I asked her, politely, to please double check, as I was sure there had to be a mistake. She just put the phone down and yelled to someone else. The second person got on the phone, and I started the whole process over. I gave her my surname, the Eurostar reservation confirmation, the works. She said they did not have it. At this point, I asked if they had any family rooms available, even if they could not find the reservation from your company, as reckoned I could straighten it out later. She said "NO!" I continued to hold my frustration at bay, and said I would call back. Next, I called Eurostar, and the rep was polite and helpful. She asked me if I minded being put on hold while she investigated, and said she would call the hotel. About 3 minutes later, apologizing for the wait, and said she had called and that we were all set. Just to make sure, I called the hotel again, and the very same woman now told me that they had our reservation. Huh? She did not apologize, nor did she offer an explanation. I have no idea what the problem is with the staff at the St. George's, but there is definitely a problem. My husband asked for the "free" internet access code, and was charged 4 pounds. It did not work until the night manager came and reset it. So much for that. The next problem with them came at breakfast. By this time, I had looked for reviews on the web of this hotel, as well as it's own web site (something I wish I had done before booking in they were not good, to say the least) The hotel has two buildings, and one small breakfast room. The tables are so close together, that my daughter (age 10, slim) could not pull her chair far enough away from the guest behind her to fit. We asked if we could move. The very curt, rude woman (who had also been at the front desk) sighed theatrically and then just said "There" in a loud voice. We moved, but the next thing we saw was her telling a single woman (of a certain age) that she had to sit somewhere else than where she was sitting. This lady was booked in because her husband was in hospital nearby. The staff did not ask her, they TOLD her to move. She was near tears. I did not hear one "please" "thank you" or anything of the sort from the entire staff. Of course the guests were the only polite people. The second day, the very rude, curt woman pointed my family and I to a table whose chairs were backed up to a wall with about 3 inches of space between them and the table. I thought "Well, she may have to move us AGAIN" and pulled out the chair for my daughter. It was so close to the wall, that it made a small nick. The woman said "Oh my God, see what you did!" by this time I had had it with her. So I replied "Oh my God, maybe you should get tables and chairs in your breakfast room that actually fit" , She moved us, to another 4 person table. Why she did not seat us there in the first place remains a mystery. AND the breakfast was extremely stingy. My 7 year old son had looked at a photo of an "English Breakfast" and was very excited to have one. Well, not only were they not "full" but Breakfast was only available between 6:30 and 8:30 am. In fact, we were told to get there by 8, or we would not be served as "we stop cooking at 8:30." In all the B and B hotels in which I have stayed, this has never been the case. Also, there was enough room for all of the guests, and refills of juice, etc. if wanted in all of the similar type hotels I had been in. And they did not require that one is down (in line--we were early, and by the time we left each morning around 7:15 (we wanted to get out as soon as possible) there was a queue up the stairs of guests trying to get their promised (and paid-for) breakfast. There is more, but I have gone on enough already. I write this because I know that many of your customers have never been to London, or have not stayed in this type of hotel. Also, you are a trusted company, and if you list it, it implies that the customer can trust that it will be at least a decent experience. The people who run this hotel are rude, and they don't care at all about their guests. I don't people who run this type of place to be super-nice, they work very, very hard, and they don't really have the time. Also, they are inexpensive. BUT there is no excuse for downright rudeness, lying, and general ill-will toward guests. I am asking you, PLEASE remove St George's Hotel (St. George's Drive, Victoria/Pimlico, London) from your "favorites" or preferred list. Or at least that that you don't promote this hotel. Sincerely, Barbara Murray

Reviews.Title: “The word 'grotty' springs to mind.”
Reviews.Author: jenr3546
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It's in a nice area, close to tourist attractions and transport links but the hotel itself is awful. Our double room was just about big enough to fit in a bed and 2 bedside tables and it looked like it hadn't been decorated since the 70s. I have to admit, that upon inspection it had been cleaned to a high standard but it didn't feel clean because every thing was so old and worn. (E.g. imagine net curtains yellowed with age). The walls are paper thin so you can hear other guests, the mattress was old and lumpy and the windows didn't lock so we had no security. The staff asked for payment upfront which I found unusual. It made sense when I saw the room though because I seriously considered walking out and trying to find somewhere else. We decided to suffer it because we had only booked 1 night but it was impossible to feel relaxed or comfortable. We didn't bother with breakfast - which is only served up to 8:30am and had to check out at 10:00am which is ridiculously early. I'm not at all happy that this hotel cost us nearly Â£90 per night. It should be a 1 star hotel and the rooms should cost about Â£20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in UK”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCalculus
Reviews.Content: Because of the threat of identity theft by the manager I am unable to give full details of the horrific night I spent in this place. Suffice it to say that you would be better off sleeping on a park bench than staying in this hellhole. Some of the reviews are surreal to put it mildly. The matter is now in the hands of my lawyer.

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor here-Basic No Frills-but Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSoul
Reviews.Content: This is just one of many hotels I stay in on my annual trips to Europe. It's a basic hotel in a great location-a five minute walk to the tube-Victoria Station: get buses from there too. Rooms are tiny-compared to American hotels, but clean. But other priciers hotels, i.e. Millenium Bailey's is also small (Singles mean one bed=one person) compared to the average American hotel, but clean. I prefer larger rooms, as to spread out, but a clean room with all the amenties (tv, Phone, private bath) is preferred over size, especially when trying to maintain cost. TIP: Don't rely on wake-up serivce here. Every morning during visits I request a wakeup, and as of yet, 7 years of staying here, I have yet to receive that wakeup call. Bring along a travel alarm clock and you'll be safe and not sorry. There's no a/c here, and you'll need hotel assistance to get the top of the windows open. If you're on a budget, yet want to be in a great location, St. George's is a good choice. There are stores and markets within walking distance; a great Pub just two blocks away. Yes, the rooms are small and the hotel is quite dated, but considering you're in London, it's a value.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: raenfae
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here due to its close proximity to Victoria station. It was about a 15-20 minute walk from Victoria coach station. It cost us Â£75 a night, including breakfast. We stayed in the "115" building, which is where the Reception was located. We arrived only to be greeted with: "Weren't you supposed to be here yesterday?" I said no, and brought out the email confirmation I had from the hotel confirming that I was arriving on 2nd July for two nights. Even then, they still seemed skeptical. They said they had made a mistake with my booking and already charged me for one night as a "no show" penalty fee. I was less than impressed with this. The credit card I had used to guarantee the room had since been reissued, so the payment did not go through as they no longer had up to date details, and the manager got very snooty about this and actually told me off about it! There was no apology for the fact they had made a mistake with my booking. Luckily the room was still available for the two nights. My friend and I were on the very, very top floor in a twin room (room 19). We counted one night...there are 9 sets of stairs to climb. It really put us off nipping to the shops as our legs just couldn't handle so many steep stairs... and we're not exactly unfit! It was during the heatwave and our room was a sauna. We could only open the window a few inches so we were in for a very sweaty visit. The room was okay... definitely a bit "tired" looking, and very outdated facilities. We were lucky it was too hot for blankets... the blanket was horribly scratchy. There was a stain on the cover of one of the beds. The room itself was very clean besides this. There was one single bed and one double bed, with a bedside table in between and a desk with two chairs, and a large mirror, and a very old fashioned hairdryer fixed to the wall. The TV was fixed to the wall. It advertises itself as 'satellite TV' but what this actually means is regular channels 1 - 5, BBC News 24 and a couple of foreign language channels. We used the TV once just fine, went out for a few hours, came back and the TV no longer worked. Luckily my friend managed to get it working again (we couldn't face the journey down to Reception again to ask them to fix it!). The alarm radio did not tune into any radio stations clearly. The bathroom was small but adequate. The plumbing was bizarre - if one person used the toilet, the other person could not use it again afterwards for a while or the flush would not work. The toilet never flushed fully. The taps/shower was the same - if it was used once and then turned off, they would not work again next time you turned them on. It took about 5 minutes for them to work again. Very frustrating. There were a few bars of soap on a high shelf in the bathroom, next to a spare toilet roll and two very water-marked glasses. I had to wash them before using them. There was no kettle in the room, and the hot water tap barely got lukewarm. I tried running the tap for a while but the sink filled up - despite the fact the plug was not in!! There was no bin in the bedroom, only in the bathroom. The room was cleaned on the second day of our stay. We came back to find it very neat. However, they had folded our pyjamas and put them under our pillows - a nice sentiment but it took us absolutely ages to find them!! They had also closed our window again, which we had left open due to the unbearable heat. We thought we were coming back to a lovely cool room but unfortunately that was not the case! Breakfast was rather poor. The menu stated: "Orange juice OR cereal" - which I realised after the waitress had already come round and offered us juice. She did not mention the fact you had to choose between this or cereal. Tea and coffee was served. I ordered coffee and it came with cream, which I thought was a nice touch. There were a choice of four different types of egg plus "bacon and sausages". What this mean was your eggs (I ordered fried and received 2 of them) plus one rasher of bacon and 1 very thin, very small sausage. Breakfast looked a bit lost on the big plate! We also got a tray of toast which was wafer thin and hard as a rock. I was not very impressed at how they skimped on the meal, though the food itself was cooked okay and tasted fine. We also got told where to sit, rather than picking the table ourselves - I noticed that other guests were told where to sit as well. Very strange. The housecleaning staff were friendly and would say hello. What a shame the actual owners of the hotel were not as friendly!!! I have stayed in a total of three different guest houses in Victoria and while this one was by far the cleanest, I have had enough of the sub-standard conditions of guest houses and will be investing in a proper hotel in future!!! I would certainly never stay here again. I heard a fellow guest say: "It's like Fawlty Towers without the sense of humour.." and I couldn't agree more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMcKinnon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. George's Hotel on St. George's Street, Pimlico, London for 4 nights. I arrived at the hotel about 10 am after a 7am arrival at Heathrow. I was pleased to find that I could check in immediately. The single, en suite room at the back of the hotel was clean and quiet. The shower was glass-doored and clean.I've heard that the rooms at 115 are better than those at 107, although I didn't see rooms in both locations. Please note that this hotel is located nowhere near Regent Street. I think I read reviews of similarly-named hotels in other parts of the city that were inadvertently posted on this site. I had no problems with the staff. I've heard that some hotel employees could be curt, but I did not experience any rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a kip”
Reviews.Author: TheDublin2
Reviews.Content: Stay elsewhere. The place hasn't been upgraded since some time in the 1960s. Got stuck in a room on the top floor, which involved traipsing up and down four flights of stairs. The staff were a real experience. Getting a wake up call was a challenge and they actually refused to order a taxi. The location is fine but it's a bit of a kip.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: Bianka1
Reviews.Content: Honestly run hotel with helpful and friendly staff. Quite high standard in comparison with other budget hotels in Victoria most of which are shabby. This one is really clean and nice. I stayed there for 3 nights with no prior reservation and was very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: egcola
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I was on a 2-week trip through Europe with 2 friends and this was by far the worst hotel we stayed at, if not ever! We checked in fine and everything, but it started off bad when we were told we were on the top floor and there was no elevator (only like 6 flights of stairs!). This was a pain every time we left or came back. The price paid included a full English breakfast that you had to sign up for beforehand, so we did. We sat waiting at the table for even the woman to come over at all for about 25 minutes (but it's free, I'll wait). Then she did come over and it was the same one who checked us in and who we also saw cleaning rooms later during our stay; I think she's the owner or something. She would just put our food in front of us without saying anything and then when we tried waving her over to get more juice, which took another 10 minutes, she said our glasses HAD to be empty so she refill the ones already used. My friend was looking for an iron and went down to asked the same miserable woman for it. Her response was, "oh, we have one but it's in another room." That was it. We needed an American adapter for the outlets and their only response was, "we used to have a lot but now we have none," so we had to spend another $20 at a store for one. The rooms were TINY! Ours had 3 twin beds in a row and we had to put our luggage in between our beds because there wasn't enough room anywhere else in the room, making it very hard to walk around. The shower door was broken and wouldn't close all the way so it was open a little every time. One day, we had no toilet paper and they didn't even refill it. I went down to the desk and there was an 8-or-so-year old girl there, of whom I asked some toilet paper from. She called someone twice on a phone and it was the SAME woman as all the times before. I just repeated that I needed toilet paper for the room because no one had refilled it. She didn't understand that the T.P. was all I wanted and then made faces at ME because she was interrupted from what she was doing and thought we were checking out (which we did about an hour later). We used a calling card and made a few calls back to the US while at the hotel. When checking out, the same woman handed us a bill for approximately $76 USD for calls made...we actually fought with her and her only response, which she kept repeating was, "well there's nothing I can do!" Umm, yes there is! Nothing about this hotel was likable - small rooms with hard beds and broken doors, an owner who apparently would rather make the people who stay in her hotel miserable than hire any other workers or ANYTHING for that fact and who was the rudest, most miserable woman I think I've ever met. I would NOT recommend this hotel for anyone. period.

Reviews.Title: “Room the size of a closet. Forced me and my girlfriend to leave our 3rd night!”
Reviews.Author: Goonie0
Reviews.Content: First, the room was TINY (Please see picture attached). I'm estimating that the room was about 4x8 feet (not including the bathroom). Here's what happened to my and my girlfriend: On the third evening of our stay we arrived back at the hotel to find that our room was not serviced (bed was unmade, towel was not replaced, etc.). We called the hotel front desk notifying them of the situation. The owner answered the phone and informed us that we could not have 2 people staying in the room (we didn't know this at the time; the owner was apparently watching us on their closed-circuit TV system). He also said no one was available to bring us a clean towel. My girlfriend agreed to go downstairs and obtain a towel from the front desk in person. When she arrived, the owner then refused to give us a clean towel and demanded that we pay the difference between a 1-person and 2-person room for all three nights of our stay, which amounted to over Â£75 in ADDITIONAL fees. My girlfriend and I apologized over the confusion, and agreed that we should pay the room difference for the last night (2/22), but we were unwilling to pay the difference for first 2 nights since we did not stay in a 2-person room the first 2 nights and also didn't receive additional services (for example, and extra/larger bed, additional towels, extra allotment for breakfast, etc.). The owner disagreed and would not accommodate. The owner wouldn't let us stay the night unless we paid the extra Â£75. Since we thought it was completely unreasonable to pay more than the difference for the third night, we were forced to leave the hotel at 12am in the morning. Luckily we were able to find another hotel a few blocks away. Right now we are trying to get a refund of the last night of the stay, since the travel agency responsible for our booking was unable to resolve the situation that evening. To be fair, the hotel was fairly clean. The bed was pretty bad though (was too old, needed to be replaced). The bathroom was small, but nice. The shower had good pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mick21
Reviews.Content: Saint Georges Hotel, London. Choose this hotel for location, which was good but everything else was disappointing. Small dark bedroom. 2 lamps, only one worked, no overhead light. Bathroom door didn't close, safe didn't work, heating didn't work, iron didn't work. Only there for 2 nights or I would have changed hotel. Continental breakfast was ok but no way should this hotel be rated 4 star. Wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly terrible - especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: lo201
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for two nights, and it was not a very happy weekend to say the least! When booking a cheap hotel such as this you don't expect the ritz, but this place was appauling. The main problem was the service from the staff. We complained about our dirty room to them (which looked basically as if they had changed the sheets but not cleaned the room itself for some time), which clearly they took offense to, and SHOUTED at me, telling me if I wasn't happy with the cleanliness of the room then to get out. Needless to say this was quite frightening and upsetting. Having already paid the Â£160 odd pounds we felt we had no choice but to stay. The staff made no attempt to offer us a cleaner room or to even listen to our complaints. Following the verbal abuse we had from them, we felt we didn't really want to breakfast there, another waste of our money. Finally (though I could go on) the wardrobe door fell off, hitting my partner on the head. We felt by this time there was absolutley no point in mentioning this to the staff, for obvious reasons! To say the staff there lack good customer service is an understatement, and the treatment we recieved completely ruined our weekend. I wouldn't go near the place again if you paid me, and considering the number of hotels there are in Victoria, I would certainly recommend for other people not to either.

Reviews.Title: “I prefer St. Patrick to St. George!”
Reviews.Author: snevets
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one Saturday night in September 2005. I read the reviews beforehand and was ready for a fight with the reception staff. However I have to say we were checked in straight away having booked & paid Â£90 through laterooms for a twin room. Parking was quoted at Â£25 for the night by the hotel and nearby car parks but when I got there the concierge let me park outside the main door for nothing! Remember this is central London! The room was great, much better than I expected. Very clean and everything worked. Breakfast is a rip off, but go towards Oxford Circus and there's plenty of choice. In my view you cannot get a better hotel for central London shopping, it's less than a five minute walk to Oxford St. Stumbled in at 3am and no problems there either. Check out was as easy as check in. If you want added service, maybe there's a problem. But if you just need to get your head down for the night try it. Don't book directly though, shop around.

HotelInfo.Name: St. George's Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 107 & 115 St George's Dr | Victoria, London SW1V 4DA, England
